results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Devil's Marbles and the Olgas
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
The film provides a geological background to residuals in an arid landscape. It shows the influence of jointing and physical and chemical weathering on rocks. Particularly stressed are spheroidal weathering, freeze-thaw, coalescing alluvial fans and the influence of vegetation on rocks.

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Filling time
results.creator_credit: Andy Walker, Colin Thomas, Aardman Animations and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Another in the series of films whose starting point is the sound track, made by pinning a radio microphone to the central character. The resulting ‘natural conversation’ was edited down to five minutes and the animator allowed free visual interpretation. This one is about a visit to the dentist.

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: David Sproxton, Peter Lord, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Based on a real life conversation, clay models are animated to act out the problems of a man attempting to get a meal from a welfare agency.

results.title: Architype
results.creator_credit: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
This brilliant short animation directed and animated by Henry Lutman uses a real conversation recording to portray two architects discussing a plan to build a new shopping mall. While the characters flick through large technical drafts of the mall a homeless man walks across the pages to reveal the social consequences of redevelopment and to show the viewer between the lines of the real conversation. The film outstandingly shows a multiplex of possible realities- the real conversation recording - the animated architects and a homeless man minimally draw into the stark architectural line drawings. The animated characters begin to seem more realistic than the real conversation recording the film is based on. This title is part of a series of animated films made by the BBC called Animated Conversations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Cat = A Macska
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hernadi and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Animalia”.
The protagonists of the film are two mice who are engaged in complicated scientific debate and keep arguing until they are unceremoniously swallowed by a cat. All things are relative.
